meanings.definition: Cause slight but persistent annoyance or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The dripping faucet niggles me all night long.
meanings.sent2: Her constant tapping on the table niggles her brother.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing fly niggles the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The scratchy tag in his shirt niggles him like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The squeaky door hinge niggles everyone in the house.

meanings.definition: A small or insignificant amount or degree.
meanings.sent1: He only had a few nigglings of interest in the subject.
meanings.sent2: The crumbs on the table were just nigglings, easily brushed away.
meanings.sent3: The tiny scratch on the car was a nigglings compared to the dent.
meanings.sent4: Her words left nigglings of doubt in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist added nigglings of color to the painting to make it pop.

meanings.definition: To spend time or effort on trivial or insignificant matters.
meanings.sent1: She niggles over which shoes to wear for hours.
meanings.sent2: He niggles about the font size instead of focusing on the content.
meanings.sent3: The team niggles over the color of the logo instead of the design.
meanings.sent4: She niggles away the afternoon rearranging her bookshelf.
meanings.sent5: He niggles with the settings on his phone instead of making calls.
